text: Leonard Edward "Lennie" Mayne (8 November 1927 - 20 May 1977) was an Australian television director. He was best known for directing four Doctor Who serials, The Curse of Peladon (1972), The Three Doctors (1972), The Monster of Peladon (1974) and The Hand of Fear (1976). He also worked on television series such as Dr. Finlay's Casebook, Warship and The Onedin Line. He was married to actress Frances Pidgeon, with whom he had twin daughters. Mayne died by drowning in a sailing accident on the English Channel in May 1977. His life is documented in the film, Looking For Lennie, which is featured on the Bluray release of the Doctor Who story, The Three Doctors. ==Other websites== * Category:1927 births Category:1977 deaths Category:Accidental deaths by drowning Category:Accidental deaths in the United Kingdom Category:Australian television directors
